io.github.msdk.datamodel.rawdata

Interface MsScan

  • All Superinterfaces:
    MsSpectrum
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractReadOnlyMsScan

    public interface MsScan
extends MsSpectrum
    Represents a single MS scan in a raw data file. This interface extends IMassSpectrum, therefore the actual data points can be accessed through the inherited methods of IMassSpectrum. If the scan is not added to any file, its data points are stored in memory. However, once the scan is added into a raw data file by calling setRawDataFile(), its data points will be stored in a temporary file that belongs to that RawDataFile. When RawDataFile.dispose() is called, the data points are discarded so the MsScan instance cannot be used anymore.

      • Methods inherited from interface io.github.msdk.datamodel.msspectra.MsSpectrum

        getIntensityValues, getIntensityValues, getMzRange, getMzValues, getMzValues, getNumberOfDataPoints, getSpectrumType, getTIC, setDataPoints, setSpectrumType

    • Method Detail

      • getRawDataFile

        @Nullable
RawDataFile getRawDataFile()
        Returns the raw data file that contains this scan. This might return null when the scan is created, but once the scan is added to the raw data file by calling RawDataFile.addScan(), the RawDataFile automatically calls the MsScan.setRawDataFile() method to update this reference.
        Returns:
        RawDataFile containing this MsScan, or null.
        See Also:
        RawDataFile

      • setRawDataFile

        void setRawDataFile(@Nonnull
                    RawDataFile newRawDataFile)
        Updates the raw data file reference. This method can be called only once. Any subsequent calls will throw the IllegalOperationException.
        Parameters:
        newRawDataFile - a RawDataFile object.

      • getScanNumber

        @Nonnull
Integer getScanNumber()
        Returns the number of this scan, represented by an integer, typically positive. Typically, the scan number will be unique within the file. However, the data model does not guarantee that, and in some cases multiple scans with the same number may be present in the file.
        Returns:
        Scan number

      • setScanNumber

        void setScanNumber(@Nonnull
                   Integer scanNumber)
        Updates the scan number.
        Parameters:
        scanNumber - New scan number.

      • getScanDefinition

        @Nullable
String getScanDefinition()
        Returns the instrument-specific textual definition of the scan parameters. For example, in Thermo raw data this may look like: FTMS + p ESI Full ms2 209.09@hcd35.00 [50.00-230.00] The scan definition can be null if not specified in the raw data.
        Returns:
        Scan definition

      • setScanDefinition

        void setScanDefinition(@Nullable
                       String scanDefinition)
        Updates the scan definition (instrument-specific textual definition of the scan parameters).
        Parameters:
        scanDefinition - New scan definition.

      • getMsFunction

        @Nonnull
MsFunction getMsFunction()
        Returns the MS function of this scan.
        Returns:
        MS function.

      • setMsFunction

        void setMsFunction(@Nonnull
                   MsFunction newFunction)
        Updates the MS function of this scan.
        Parameters:
        newFunction - New MS function.

      • getMsScanType

        @Nonnull
MsScanType getMsScanType()
        Returns the type of the MS scan. If unknown, MsScanType.UNKNOWN is returned.
        Returns:
        MS scan type

      • setMsScanType

        void setMsScanType(@Nonnull
                   MsScanType newMsScanType)
        Updates the MS scan type.
        Parameters:
        newMsScanType - a MsScanType object.

      • getChromatographyInfo

        @Nullable
ChromatographyInfo getChromatographyInfo()
        Returns the chromatography data (retention time, etc.) associated with this scan. Null is returned if no chromatography data is available.
        Returns:
        Associated chromatography data.

      • setChromatographyInfo

        void setChromatographyInfo(@Nullable
                           ChromatographyInfo chromatographyInfo)
        Updates the associated chromatography data.
        Parameters:
        chromatographyInfo - a ChromatographyInfo object.

      • getScanningRange

        @Nullable
com.google.common.collect.Range<Double> getScanningRange()
        Returns the scanning range of the instrument. Note that this value is different from that returned by getMzRange() from the MassSpectrum interface. getMzRange() returns the range of the actual data points (lowest and highest m/z) getScanningRange() returns the instrument scanning range that was configured in the experiment setup.
        Returns:
        The scanning m/z range of the instrument

      • setScanningRange

        void setScanningRange(@Nullable
                      com.google.common.collect.Range<Double> newScanRange)
        Updates the instrument scanning m/z range.
        Parameters:
        newScanRange - New scanning range.

      • getPolarity

        @Nonnull
PolarityType getPolarity()
        Returns the polarity of this scan. If unknown, PolarityType.UNKNOWN is returned.
        Returns:
        Polarity of this scan.

      • setPolarity

        void setPolarity(@Nonnull
                 PolarityType newPolarity)
        Updates the polarity of this scan.
        Parameters:
        newPolarity - New scan polarity.

      • getSourceInducedFragmentation

        @Nullable
ActivationInfo getSourceInducedFragmentation()
        Returns the fragmentation parameters of ion source-induced fragmentation, or null if no such information is known.
        Returns:
        Fragmentation info of ion source-induced fragmentation, or null.

      • setSourceInducedFragmentation

        void setSourceInducedFragmentation(@Nullable
                                   ActivationInfo newFragmentationInfo)
        Updates the fragmentation parameters of ion source-induced fragmentation.
        Parameters:
        newFragmentationInfo - New fragmentation parameters.

      • getIsolations

        @Nonnull
List<IsolationInfo> getIsolations()
        Returns a list of isolations performed for this scan. These isolations may also include fragmentations (tandem MS).
        Returns:
        A mutable list of isolations. New isolation items can be added to this list.
